User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

It is possible to close the last opened tab when the user clicks too fast, using the middle-mouse button to close opened tabs. When Firefox is started again, the tabs stored from a previous session are shown instead of the last tab closed.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Preparation
1. Ensure that the 'Restore tabs on startup' option is enabled.
2. Open some webpages on multiple tabs, and close Firefox using the Close button.
3. Restart Firefox: the previously opened tabs are shown.

Reproduction
4. Fast click with the middle mouse button on the first tab to close all tabs. The last tab is also closed when fast enough (normally this is not possible).
5. Firefox is automatically closed.
6. Restart Firefox.
Actual Results:  
The tabs from a previous session are shown.

Expected Results:  
The last tab from the current session; or at least that it is never possible to middle-click close the last tab.
comments.creator: pelsmaeker+bugzilla@gmail.com

comments.text:
Another way to reproduce this bug:

4. Press CTRL+W, and keep it pressed. The last tab is now also closed.
5. Firefox is automatically closed.
6. Restart Firefox.
